alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 19 at 1:39PM PST until January 21 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves peaking at 8 to 10 feet with sets to 11 feet late Saturday and Saturday night then slowly subsiding through Sunday evening. Highest on west-facing beaches. Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Nuisance coastal flooding possible during early morning high tides.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
